userPromptForThisRevision:
Make a single-screen 2D pixel-art platformer.
Dark-navy background.
Player = small blue square that can run and jump.
Brown platforms float at different heights.
Yellow coins to collect (show Coins: counter top-right).
Hidden spike traps and a full spike floor—touch = respawn.
Yellow key pickup unlocks a brown door (door at top-left).
Display Level 1 top-left.
Goal: grab key ➜ reach door to win

imageAssets.description: Pixel art player character sprite sheet: A small, solid blue square (approx 16x16 or 20x20 pixels). Sprites for: 1. Idle (still), 2. Run frame 1, 3. Run frame 2 (for a 2-frame cycle), 4. Jump/Fall pose (e.g., slightly elongated or static). Arrange horizontally, clearly separated, on a transparent background.
imageAssets.purpose: Player character sprite sheet (idle, run, jump/fall).

imageAssets.description: Pixel art platform tile: A single brown, somewhat earthy textured rectangular block (e.g., 16x16 or 20x20 pixels). Texture should be simple and allow for tiling if needed, but primarily used as individual blocks. Transparent background.

Pixel art coin sprite sheet: A small, bright yellow, circular coin (approx 12x12 or 14x14 pixels). Provide 3-4 frames for a simple spin or gleam animation. Arrange horizontally, clearly separated, on a transparent background.

Pixel art spike trap sprite sheet: Sharp, menacing-looking spikes, dark grey or metallic color (approx 16x10 pixels, designed to sit on a platform). Sprites for: 1. Visible spikes, 2. 'Hidden/Camouflaged' state (e.g., subtly blended with brown platform color, or just tips showing). Arrange horizontally, clearly separated, on a transparent background.
imageAssets.purpose: Spike trap hazard sprite (visible and camouflaged/hidden states).

imageAssets.description: Pixel art key sprite sheet: A small, bright yellow, classic door key shape (approx 16x10 or 18x12 pixels). Provide 2-3 frames for a gentle pulse or shimmer animation. Arrange horizontally, clearly separated, on a transparent background.

Pixel art door sprite sheet: A brown, wooden-looking door (approx 24x32 or 30x40 pixels, to fit player scale). Sprites for: 1. 'Locked' (closed, prominent keyhole), 2. 'Unlocked/Open' (e.g., slightly ajar, or showing a dark opening). Arrange horizontally, clearly separated, on a transparent background.

Pixel art full spike floor tile: A tileable texture (e.g., 16x16 or 20x16 pixels) of upward-pointing spikes, dark grey or metallic. Designed to be tiled horizontally for a continuous hazard. Transparent background if spikes don't fill tile, otherwise opaque.
imageAssets.purpose: Repeating tile for the full spike floor hazard.

imageAssets.description: Pixel art tileable background texture: A very dark navy blue (e.g., #00001A to #00002A range) base with sparse, tiny, lighter blue or white pixel 'stars' or subtle abstract details. Should be minimalistic and not distracting. A tileable texture (e.g., 128x128 or 256x256 pixels).
imageAssets.purpose: Tileable game background texture for a dark, starry/moody sky effect.
